page.title: 01Elton/Birchover/Gratton
page.content: This area is in the Peak National Park and comprises the parishes of Elton, Gratton and Birchover. It is in the White Peak of Derbyshire ranging in height from 170m. to 330m. and is drained by tributaries of the River Lathkill. The scenery is varied, ranging from dry limestone moor with remains of old leadmines, now enclosed for grazing, rocky gritstone outcrops, some woodland and plantations, and meadows and pasture in the dales. The houses are all stone-built and are concentrated in the villages with only a few outlying farms. Fields are small, bounded mainly by stone walls. In addition to dairy and beef cattle farming the area is being increasingly used for walking, camping and other leisure pursuits.
